sad: Do nice stuff for yourself. Go for walks, buy flowers, eat fresh fruit.
Dress nice. Don't wear sweat suits. Wear stuff you like, that make you feel good.
Laugh every chance you get. It will sound strangled at first but it will come back.
Don't write poems about your feelings. Write about stuff that is outside you, that strengthens your curiosity. Be a reporter, not an empath.
fear: Take time out – The first thing to do is take time out so you can physically calm down.
Breathe through panic - if you start to get a faster heartbeat or sweating palms, the best thing is not to fight it.
Face your fears - Avoiding fears only makes them scarier. Whatever your fear, if you face it, it should start to fade.
Talk about it - Sharing fears takes away a lot of their scariness.
disgust: Notice when judgmental thoughts pop into your head
Don't let your feelings control your thinking.
Do the opposite of what you're feeling.
Talk to someone you trust about your feelings.
